data.description:
## Goal (WHY)
Demonstrate Sprint 2 capabilities: transferring knowledge between domains and self-assessing knowledge gaps.

## Deliverable
Create: scripts/sprint_28_demo.py

## Demo Requirements
1. Show domain creation (e.g., "fluid dynamics" and "electronics")
2. Show structural mapping registration
3. Show knowledge transfer: fact in domain A -> inferred fact in domain B
4. Show metacognitive assessment: "I'm confident about X, uncertain about Y"
5. Show knowledge gap identification
6. All assertions must pass

## Test Requirements
Location: tests/integration/test_sprint_28_demo.py

```python
def test_demo_runs_without_error():
    result = subprocess.run(["python", "scripts/sprint_28_demo.py"], ...)
    assert result.returncode == 0
    assert b"DEMO COMPLETE" in result.stdout
```

Verification: python scripts/sprint_28_demo.py && python -m pytest tests/integration/test_sprint_28_demo.py -v

## Anti-Patterns
- Do NOT create demo without self-verification
- Do NOT skip analogical transfer demonstration
- Do NOT skip metacognition demonstration

## Freedom Zone
- Demo narrative and domain examples
- Output formatting
- Additional scenarios

## Definition of Done (Sprint 2)
When this task is complete, Sprint 2 is complete:
- [ ] AnalogicalReasoner transfers knowledge between domains
- [ ] MetacognitiveMonitor identifies knowledge gaps
- [ ] Demo script runs and self-verifies
- [ ] All tests pass with ≥95% coverage on new code

## Reference: docs/definition-of-done.md
data.title: Create Sprint 2 Demo: Analogical Transfer and Metacognition
